column4: did you try the connection from another host, not just yours ?
Does it run in passive mode ?
try to use a proxy to check
where would I find a proxy server for ftp
I am not sure where exactly, try on anonymous proxy lists
how is your client secured: just on your server with iptables or do you have a router in between ?
I could check your server if it works for me too
what do u mean with it works on and off ?
like today it worked from a friends house and he just dll'ed some media
it does not timeout when you connect via localhost - ergo, there is a connection problem
why it worked for your friend - no clue
I just can say, I faced the same problems till I opened up a passive range
take a look at this to explain the ftp modes: http://www.linuxhomenetworking.com/wiki/index.php/Quick_HOWTO_:_Ch15_:_Linux_FTP_Server_Setup
